issue.title: Proposal: metrics collection with OpenTelemetry
issue.body:
## Status Quo

This library expose some internal metrics from https://github.com/elastic/elastic-transport-go, through the [`BaseClient.Metrics` method](https://github.com/elastic/go-elasticsearch/blob/52a4e606b428a58719d582141a4a724c88372e15/elasticsearch.go#L373).

## Problem

Current metrics and instrumentation do not provide high visibility on this library behavior.
For server side use of this library (i.e. apm-server) this leads to blind spots that decrease troubleshooting and root cause analysis capabilities.

## Approach

The proposed solution is to adopt the OpenTelemetry Metrics SDK in this library and its dependencies to gather relevant runtime metrics.

To avoid any performance penalty from this change we can default to use the global OpenTelemetry MeterProvider, which is either set by the library user or defaults to a no-op implementation.

forkee.name: go-elasticsearch
forkee.description: The official Go client for Elasticsearch

issue.title: Malformed action/metadata line [339], expected START_OBJECT or END_OBJECT but found [VALUE_STRING]
issue.body:
I am reading from a file containing newline delimited json (written by a golang process), with each line containing a single json line.
I am adding these lines to a BulkIndexer one at a time.
A little while after starting the process, I always get this error:
```
{"error":{"root_cause":[{"type":"illegal_argument_exception","reason":"Malformed action/metadata line [339], expected START_OBJECT or END_OBJECT but found [VALUE_STRING]"}],"type":"illegal_argument_exception","reason":"Malformed action/metadata line [339], expected START_OBJECT or END_OBJECT but found [VALUE_STRING]"},"status":400}
```

When I turn on debugging, I can see the requests being made, with most of them being fine, such as:
```
{"index":{}}
{"lang":"en","text":"blah blah blah"}
```

But then I find one like this in the last request made (the one that errored):
```
{"index":{}}
h blah"}
{"lang":"en","text":"blah bla
```

When I check my input file, the line containing that info is valid and on a single line, so I don't know how on earth this is getting messed up when put into the BulkIndexer.

issue.body:


When I turn on debugging, I can see the requests being made, with most of them being fine, such as:

comment.body: A solution seem to have been found to the initial issue, closing.

issue.title: Fix Conn Leak problem mentioned in issuse #159 for 6.x branch
issue.body:
The problem mentioned in #159 also happens to me when using 6.x sdk for elasticsearch 6.x. I have confirmed that all this two are the same ones.
So, is that anyone can help to merge this bug fixing and create a new release for 6.x branch?

Typed Api : Getting Json version of the Payload from the request
issue.body: First of all, thank you for adding the **typedapi** package for strong typing. I wanted to know whether you have exposed any **API** or **Methods** or **sub-packages** to get the **actual JSON of the payload** that gets sent in the request to the Elasticsearch deployment?

comment.body: Closing this in the absence of a reply.

issue.title: Feature request: support version and version_type on BulkIndexerItem
issue.body: Current there is no way to specify the document version in bulk actions. It would be very useful to expose those parameters for the bulk indexes

comment.body: This is very much still in the roadmap, I'm closing this issue in favor of the one in Kibana.

issue.title: Add PR #212 to master branch
issue.body: PR https://github.com/elastic/go-elasticsearch/pull/212 has been applied to `7.x`, `7.11`, and `7.10` but hasn't been applied to `master` due to failures in CI. Creating this issue to track this for future work.
